meanings.definition: A sudden and complete breakdown or failure.
meanings.sent1: The old car's engine went kablooey on the way to the store.
meanings.sent2: The balloon made a loud kablooey when it popped.
meanings.sent3: The plan to surprise Mom with breakfast in bed went kablooey when the eggs burned.
meanings.sent4: The team's chances of winning went kablooey when their star player got injured.
meanings.sent5: The computer's hard drive went kablooey, causing all the data to be lost.

meanings.sent1: The fireworks made a loud kablooey in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The thunder made a sudden kablooey that startled the children.
meanings.sent3: The kablooey of the firecrackers scared the birds away from the trees.
meanings.sent4: The kablooey of the car crash echoed through the quiet street.
meanings.sent5: The kablooey of the cannon signaled the start of the race.

meanings.definition: To explode or burst suddenly and violently.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks kablooeyed in a burst of colors in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The balloon kablooeyed when it hit the sharp edge.
meanings.sent3: The kids' excitement kablooeyed when they saw the magician's trick.
meanings.sent4: The watermelon kablooeyed into juicy pieces when it fell off the table.
meanings.sent5: The volcano kablooeyed with a loud roar, spewing ash into the air.
